{"id":1510981650,"question_id":2792,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"3 weeks","timestamp":1737073791,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"20 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1510981650/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Neighboring Bitwise XOR","memory":"275.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    bool doesValidArrayExist(vector<int>& derived) {\n        // bitwise XOR (⊕) of adjacent values in a binary array original of length n.\n        int n = derived.size();\n        vector<int> original(n+1, 0);\n        original[0] = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++) {\n            original[i+1] = original[i] ^ derived[i];\n        };\n        bool checkForZero = (original[0]==original.back());\n        original[0] = 1;\n        for(int i=0; i<n; i++) {\n            original[i+1] = original[i] ^ derived[i];\n        };\n        bool checkForOne = (original[0]==original.back());\n        return   checkForZero |  checkForOne;   \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"neighboring-bitwise-xor","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
